haiku:
Amber dust drifts down
One charge tugs the void awake
Lines hum, unseen, taut

Winter air crackles
Coulomb counts the pull between
Two grains leap apart

Closed surfaces breathe
Gauss whispers through all the flux
Net inside speaks now

Dawn paints empty air
A field threads every gap wide
Guiding test charges

Blue arcs lick the wire
Electric storms in glass thin
Hair lifts, eyes widen

Iron filings bloom
Magnet makes north seek south still
Hidden loops align

Compass needle waits
Each pole claims a direction
Opposites will kiss

Arrow on a page
Vector adds with steady grace
Tail to tip, we go

Copper river sings
Ampere names the flowing count
Coils warm in dusk slow

Hilltop holds its hush
Potential waits to fall
Release turns to work

Four laws braid the air
Maxwell ties light to charge fast
Waves write on the void

Battery dawn glows
Voltage pushes, eager, on
Sparks choose shortest path

Loop closes like breath
Circuit guides the restless flow
Return completes song

Rough wire slows the rush
Resistor turns heat from haste
Calm in every lamp

Night river keeps time
Current carries charge along
Murmur through the grid

Plates face, silent, close
Capacitor hoards calm light
Then dumps it in bursts

Wound loops guard their flux
Inductor hates sudden change
It lags, yet endures

Hands lift a stone high
Work is force times distance moved
Energy pays back

Pebble leaves my palm
Trajectory curves in air
Parabola traced

Two directions meet
Cross product gives a third way
Right hand sets the sign

Starlight spills softly
Radiation ferries warmth
Across coldest void

Thin metal reaches
Antenna drinks the sky's song

Hollow tube of light

Evening hums with news

Voices cross the miles

Sunbeam slips through leaves
Poynting shows where power flows
Energy in flight

Air snaps into light

Two spheres in dark hang
Coulomb tugs by r squared law

Surface made of math
Gauss counts flux through closed skins all

A field threads every point here
